login.title: Unload your mind, gently
login.subtitle: Try a short guided check-in with yourself
login.tagline: Clarify what you are really carrying, then choose one small exit.
login.previewHint: You can start a guided preview without creating an account. Your notes stay only in this session.
login.google.notice.prefix: This system uses Google sign‑in. Please read the
journal.title: Reflection journal
journal.subtitle: Record your daily tasks and reflections to track your growth.
journal.dailyQuote.title: Quote of the day
journal.dailyQuote.stagePrefix: Today, the part you may want to care for first:
journal.stats.today.title: Today's boundary observation
journal.stats.week.title: This week's exploration trend
journal.stats.month.title: This month's emotion focus
journal.topWorries.title: Top concerns today
journal.details.title: Today's tasks
journal.focus.aspectHint: Looking at this sentence now, which part do you feel you cared about the most then?
journal.focus.aspectPrefix: At that time, you were mainly caring about:
journal.edit.label: Reflection
journal.edit.placeholder: Write down your reflections and learnings...
journal.edit.todayDiffHint: Looking at this today, is there anything you see differently from back then?
journal.view.label: Reflection journal
journal.perspective.reality.hint: This time you started from the concrete conditions and limits of the situation.
journal.perspective.distance.hint: This time you took a step back and looked at things from a future or observer's view.
journal.perspective.value.hint: This time you returned to the values and needs that matter to you to understand this feeling.
journal.perspective.observe.hint: This time you chose to keep the feeling as it is and give yourself more time to notice it.
journal.perspective.reality.placeholder: For example: What really cannot change right now… / What I can adjust for myself is…
journal.perspective.distance.placeholder: For example: Three years from now, I might say to my present self…
journal.perspective.value.placeholder: For example: The value being touched here is… because I really care about…
layout.logout.label: Log out
dashboard.header.title: Today, you choose your boundaries.
dashboard.header.subtitle: Amid all the outside noise, which parts genuinely belong to you?
dashboard.quick.title: Recent observation overview
dashboard.quick.hint.high: Recently, your scores lean toward the higher range, suggesting you're often noticing what you can influence.
dashboard.quick.hint.mid: Recently, your scores tend to be in the middle range, suggesting you see the interaction between yourself, others, and the environment.
dashboard.quick.hint.low: Recently, your scores lean toward the lower range, suggesting you're also aware of the parts that are harder to change.
dashboard.insight.title: Today's observations
dashboard.insight.distribution: Task distribution: {{mine}} mine, {{shared}} shared, {{theirs}} others' tasks
dashboard.focus.emotion.title: Most explored emotion
dashboard.focus.emotion.subtitle: This emotion appeared {{count}} times in your records.
dashboard.focus.view.title: Most used perspective
dashboard.focus.view.subtitle: Recently, you most often explored from: {{label}}
dashboard.focus.quote.title: Neutral reflection
dashboard.focus.quote.subtitle: A sentence to quietly accompany your current exploration.
nps.title: Would you like to share some feedback?
nps.subtitle: From 0 to 10, how likely are you to recommend Unload to a friend or colleague?
nps.placeholder: Anything you especially liked or felt could be improved? (optional)
newTask.step1.title: What is your inner voice saying right now?
newTask.step1.subtitle: Start from the emotion or state that feels the most present at this moment.
newTask.step1.customPlaceholder: If you prefer your own wording, you can add it here...
newTask.step2.title: In one sentence, describe how you feel today
newTask.step2.subtitle: It can be a concrete event or simply the feeling that stands out the most.
newTask.step2.customPlaceholder: In one sentence, what are you mainly focusing on right now?
newTask.step2.aspect.title: In this sentence, what are you mainly caring about?
newTask.step3.title: Boundary observation: whose space is this?
newTask.step3.subtitle: Return to that sentence and sense whose choices or actions it mostly relates to.
newTask.step3.boundaryReflection: You are now placing your focus in the space of "{{boundary}}".
newTask.step3.neutralResult: You've identified the boundary of this situation. Now, let's explore how much influence you feel you have.
newTask.step4.title: Right now, how much influence do you feel you have?
newTask.step4.subtitle: Use an approximate percentage to mark how much influence you subjectively feel at this moment.
newTask.step4.scaleMax: 100%: It almost fully depends on me
newTask.step4.hintTitle: You can look at it like this:
newTask.step4.hint1: If you mark around 0–20%, it may mean you see most conditions as coming from others or the environment.
newTask.step4.hint2: If you mark between 20–60%, it may mean you sense mutual influence between you and others.
newTask.step4.hint3: If you mark above 60%, it may mean you notice many parts are linked to your own choices and actions.
newTask.step4.reflectionPlaceholder: Write down anything you want to remember about this task – feelings, insights, or a short note to your future self...
newTask.error.controlInvalid: Your current mark differs from the suggested range based on the previous boundary step. You can revisit how you feel about it.
newTask.result.title: Task created
newTask.result.subtitle: You've completed the first step of clarifying your situation.
newTask.result.quote.low: Not everything is yours to control – recognizing this is already a way of caring for yourself.
newTask.result.quote.mid: You are learning to stand in the middle: doing what you can, and gently letting the rest go.
newTask.result.quote.high: When you focus your energy on what you can actually do, the future quietly starts to shift in your favor.
newTask.result.feedback.low: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, many factors are beyond you. Accepting what you cannot change can ease unnecessary anxiety.
newTask.result.feedback.mid: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, this is a shared task. The key is to focus on what you can influence and communicate with the people involved.
newTask.result.feedback.high: You identified the task "{{category}}", and your main concern is "{{worry}}". With control at {{control}}%, this is mostly your task. You hold most of the agency here - it may be time to lay out a concrete action plan.
newTask.result.reflection.low: Which parts of this task are truly outside of your control? What would it feel like to accept them?
newTask.result.reflection.mid: For this shared task, how could you communicate or collaborate with the other side more effectively?
newTask.result.reflection.high: You already hold most of the control. Are you ready to take action now?
onboarding.step1.title: Step 1｜Click "Start Discovery" on the dashboard
onboarding.step1.description: On the dashboard, click "Start Discovery" once to enter the first step of creating a new exploration.
onboarding.step2.title: Step 2｜Create a new exploration on the page
onboarding.step2.description: On the New Task page, follow the steps to write down what currently feels most stuck.
onboarding.step2.point1: Choose the emotion or state that feels the most present as today's focus.
onboarding.step2.point2: Pick the concern or focus that matters the most, so the question becomes clearer.
onboarding.step2.point3: In your own words, turn what has been circling in your mind into one clear record.
onboarding.step2.subtext: You don't have to figure everything out at once – just leave one clear exploration for today.
onboarding.step3.title: Step 3｜Look back through the reflection journal
onboarding.step3.description: After finishing an exploration, you can come back to the reflection journal to review how you've been moving.
onboarding.step3.point1: In the sidebar, click "Journal" to see the tasks and notes you've created.
onboarding.step3.point2: Notice which emotions and themes show up often, and how your patterns change over time.
onboarding.step3.point3: When new feelings appear, open another exploration to gently clarify them.
onboarding.step3.subtext: Unload isn't asking you to figure everything out at once – it simply helps you leave traces, then gently look back at yourself through the reflection journal.
onboarding.step4.title: One small exit a day to gently rewrite the cycle
onboarding.step4.description: By spending a few minutes each day recording your emotions and boundary observations, Unload offers a matching small practice for where you are in the cycle today, so you can slowly shift the pattern.
onboarding.step4.point1: Leaving traces of the present in your journal
onboarding.step4.point2: Looking back and noticing your shifts over time
onboarding.step4.point3: Finding ways to support yourself when you need it
wizard.maxSelections: You can select up to {{count}} options.
taskCategory.Interview_hint: Your body feels tight, heart rate goes up, and your mind keeps replaying different possibilities.
taskCategory.CareerPlanning_hint: You feel preoccupied about the future or an outcome, thinking a lot but not having a clear answer yet.
taskCategory.SelfConfusion_hint: You're not quite sure what you really want, or whether your current direction feels right for you.
taskCategory.ProgressAnxiety_hint: You sense that something didn't go as well as you'd hoped, and your energy or motivation drops a little.
taskCategory.ExpectationPressure_hint: It feels like a lot is resting on your shoulders and you need to hold everything together.
taskCategory.FinancialPressure_hint: Both body and mind feel tired, and a part of you simply wants to pause and rest.
taskCategory.MarketChange_hint: You notice changes around you and feel a bit unsettled, as if the direction ahead is still blurry.
taskCategory.Other_hint: When anger shows up, it may be pointing to a boundary or value that matters to you.
taskCategory.Custom_hint: If what you're feeling is a bit different, you can name it in your own words.
taskWorry.Performance_hint: Worried you won't perform well enough, might make mistakes, or fall short of expectations (e.g. in an interview or presentation).
taskWorry.Rejection_hint: Afraid of being turned down, ignored, or having your ideas rejected (e.g. job applications or proposals).
taskWorry.OthersThoughts_hint: Concerned about what others think of you for example, being seen as not capable, not hardworking, or not fitting in.
taskWorry.Pressure_hint: You look fine on the surface, but feel a long-term sense of tension, fatigue, or emotional heaviness with no clear single cause.
taskWorry.Comparison_hint: Often comparing yourself with peers, colleagues, or classmates and feeling like you're falling behind.
taskWorry.TimeStress_hint: Feeling like there's never enough time, your schedule is packed, or you're worried you can't juggle all your roles.
taskWorry.Decision_hint: Getting stuck between options, afraid of choosing wrong or missing a once-in-a-lifetime chance.
taskWorry.Uncertainty_hint: Feeling unsure about your future direction, job stability, or life path – the road ahead looks blurry.
taskWorry.Other_hint: If your concern is more unique, you can describe it in your own words.
owner.Mine_hint: For example: how much you prepare, which actions you take, or whether you reach out for help – things mostly up to you.
owner.Theirs_hint: For example: company decisions, the other person's emotions and choices, or the overall economy – things you can't decide alone.
owner.Shared_hint: For example: collaboration on a project, communication quality, or relationship patterns that usually need both sides to adjust.
history.title: History
history.search.placeholder: Search for situations and thought fragments you've recorded before
history.worry.label: Focus at that time:
history.polarity.label: Which side of the story
history.boundary.overview.title: Boundary distribution overview
history.boundary.overview.subtitle: See how often your records fall into your own, others', or shared boundaries.
history.finalMessage.label: The sentence you left for yourself back then
history.finalMessage.placeholder: If there wasn't a specific closing sentence, this record is still here quietly keeping you company.
history.control.label: Self-rated influence then
history.empty.title: No matching records found
history.modal.title: Delete this record?
history.modal.message: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
taskCategoryPositive.Interview_hint: For example: feeling you did better than expected in an interview, receiving clear feedback, or understanding yourself better.
taskCategoryPositive.CareerPlanning_hint: For example: gaining a bit more clarity about your path, discovering new options, or making a decision that feels right for now.
taskCategoryPositive.SelfConfusion_hint: For example: noticing your strengths and values more clearly, or finding something that gives you a sense of accomplishment.
taskCategoryPositive.ProgressAnxiety_hin: For example: completing a small step, moving slightly closer to your goal than yesterday.
taskCategoryPositive.ExpectationPressure: For example: feeling understood or supported after talking with someone whose expectations matter to you.
taskCategoryPositive.FinancialPressure_h: For example: saving a bit more than before, stabilizing your income, or finding a more workable arrangement.
taskCategoryPositive.MarketChange_hint: For example: learning a new skill or spotting new career options because of market changes.
taskCategoryPositive.Other_hint: Any situation where you feel that, despite the stress, something good also happened.
taskCategoryPositive.Custom_hint: Any situation where you feel that, despite the stress, something good also happened.
taskWorryPositive.Performance_hint: For example: realizing some parts went better than you thought, or being recognized for certain strengths.
taskWorryPositive.Rejection_hint: For example: even when results aren't ideal, you still try again or learn something from it.
taskWorryPositive.OthersThoughts_hint: For example: discovering others' views are kinder than you feared, or receiving genuine appreciation.
taskWorryPositive.Pressure_hint: For example: learning to rest, set boundaries, or ask for help when you're under pressure.
taskWorryPositive.Comparison_hint: For example: letting go of harsh comparisons and starting to see your own rhythm and value.
taskWorryPositive.Decision_hint: For example: even without a perfect answer, making the choice that feels most suitable for you right now.
taskWorryPositive.Uncertainty_hint: For example: allowing yourself to slow down and observe instead of rushing to a forced answer.
taskWorryPositive.Other_hint: Any moment where you feel there is something good, even inside a difficult situation.
taskWorryPositive.Custom_hint: Any moment where you feel there is something good, even inside a difficult situation.
newTask.perspective.reality.title: Perspective A — Reality
newTask.perspective.reality.q1: What is currently draining your energy the most, yet feels least helpful?
newTask.perspective.reality.q2: If the situation cannot change for now, which expectation would you be willing to gently put down?
newTask.perspective.distance.title: Perspective B — Distance
newTask.perspective.distance.q1: Looking back from three years in the future, how might you describe this event?
newTask.perspective.distance.q2: What kind of nourishment could this emotion offer to your future self?
newTask.perspective.value.title: Perspective C — Values
newTask.perspective.value.q1: Which personal principle that matters to you most is being touched here?
newTask.perspective.value.q2: Right now, which core need of yours (e.g. respect, autonomy) is this feeling trying to protect?
newTask.perspective.observe.title: Keep this feeling for now
newTask.perspective.observe.q1: I'm not ready to sort this out yet — I want to keep this feeling and observe it a bit longer.
newTask.perspective.observe.q2: You can simply notice how you feel now and return to this task when you feel more ready to explore it.
newTask.perspective.reality.hint: When you look from reality's side, the focus is to sort: what you can adjust now, and what is not in your hands.
newTask.perspective.distance.hint: A distance-based view helps you place today's feelings on a longer timeline.
newTask.perspective.value.hint: A values-based view shows you which of your important principles this moment is touching.
newTask.perspective.observe.hint: Keeping the feeling as it is is also a way of caring for yourself, without rushing to an answer.
newTask.finalMessage.label: One last sentence to yourself (optional)
newTask.finalMessage.placeholder: After this exploration, what is one sentence you would like to leave for yourself?
newTask.closingMessage: This round of self‑reflection is complete. Your insights have been saved.
newTask.closingQuote: True freedom is the ability to choose your attitude.
